root: ^Confidence isn’t something that just happens; it’s built over time. How do you feel about your confidence levels?

s: ^I feel pretty confident in myself, most of the time.
^I struggle with confidence, especially around others.
^I pretend to be confident, but I’m not sure if I really am.

Confident_Most_Of_Time: ^That’s great to hear. Confidence will take you far, especially if you keep believing in yourself. What makes you feel most confident?

s: ^When I succeed in something I’ve worked hard at.
^When I get encouragement from people around me.

Success_Makes_Confident: ^Hard work pays off, and the success that follows is well-deserved. Keep working hard, and confidence will continue to grow.
Encouragement_Makes_Confident: ^Having a good support system can work wonders for confidence. Remember to surround yourself with positive influences.
Struggle_With_Confidence: ^Struggling with confidence is normal, especially when you’re facing new challenges. What situations make you feel the least confident?

s: ^When I have to speak in front of people.
^When I’m trying something I’ve never done before.

Public_Speaking: ^Public speaking can be nerve-wracking, but it’s a skill that can be learned over time. Practice and preparation can make all the difference.
New_Experiences: ^New experiences are always challenging, but each one helps you grow. With each new thing you try, your confidence will increase bit by bit.
Fake_Confidence: ^Pretending to be confident can sometimes help you feel more confident, but it’s important to build true self-belief. What would help you feel more genuinely confident?

s: ^Having more successes to show for my efforts.
^I’m not sure, I just want to feel better about myself.

More_Successes: ^Success is a great confidence builder, but remember that failures are a part of success too. Every setback is just a step towards your next success.
Feel_Better_About_Myself: ^Confidence starts within. You have to remind yourself of your strengths and accept your weaknesses. That’s the first step toward building genuine confidence.
